conclusion: Use principles of mechanics to find coefficient of friction μ
Identify given values: mass 15 kg, pull force 90 N, gravitational acceleration 10 m/s², sin θ 0.6, μ is coefficient of friction
Calculate acceleration due to gravity: a = 10 m/s²
Use principle of motion to find frictional force: F_friction = μ × 90
Net force equals mass times acceleration: 90 + μ × 90 = 150
Frictional force is proportional to supporting force: 2/3 × 90 = 90μ
Solve for θ using sin θ = 2/3
Angle θ is between pull force and horizontal
